issue.title: parser_urdf accidentally shares gazebo extensions across different models

content.raw:
I had to look into this a bit more as plugins from one model are getting loaded into others. It seems like this bug only affects `blobs` and `visual_blobs`.

`blobs` will not seg fault as it uses `Clone`, but is affected by the regression: ([L1416](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/3c73f4c32d8c20e368c583ddbbc791bf37f14331/src/parser_urdf.cc?at=sdf_1.4#cl-1416)):
```
 _elem->LinkEndChild((*blobIt)->Clone());
```

`visual_blobs` seg faults as `Clone` is not used. The Element gets linked against the first model, and generates a runtime error against the second one ([L1366](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/3c73f4c32d8c20e368c583ddbbc791bf37f14331/src/parser_urdf.cc?at=sdf_1.4#cl-1366)):
```
_elem->LinkEndChild(*blob);
```

I am not sure if calls to `InitModelString` are multi-threaded or not, but it looks to me that the usage is not thread safe. It's probably a better idea to initialize it on the stack locally in `InitModelString` and pass it around. I'm having some difficulty right now compiling gazebo & sdformat from scratch, so I can't test out a patch.
